meaningMnemonic:
Multiple <kanji>symptom</kanji>s combine to make a <vocabulary>syndrome</vocabulary>. If you see this at the end of a word, you know it means "______ syndrome," or else indicates some kind of health condition.  

〜症 is used in medical terms for certain health conditions, symptoms, or syndromes, like 熱中症 (heatstroke) or 認知症 (dementia).
readingMnemonic: Since this is attached to things, it's treated like a jukugo word, so the on'yomi reading is used here.
